Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment:
I think you should stop complaining about Michael Bay ruining Transformers and Ninja Turtles, I'm not defending his movies, but here it is:

¬†- There are still some recent Transformers and Ninja Turtles cartoons that most people that watched, liked, even the long-time fans, go check Transformers Prime and Nickelodeon's TMNT cartoon.¬†

- Most of these live-action movies based on cartoons, anime, toys and video games suck anyway, and many of these franchises stayed strong after these failures and reverted to their roots.

- As I heard, The Ninja Turtles live-action movies from the 1990s aren't that good either, people love them today because of nostalgia, the first one is mixed, the second one is hated, the third one is considered one of the worst movies ever.

- The Ninja Turtles franchise was really whored in the 90s, go search for all the nonsensical licensed products they had back then, the live-action series, and the rock concert, if it wasn't ruining back then, why it's ruining only now?

¬†- The classic Ninja Turtles and Transformers versions you liked won't stop existing because of the new versions, Michael Bay is not sending people to your homes to destroy all the copies you have of these classic shows.

- Michael Bay is just a producer in this one, not a director,

- Your childhood is a lie, I'm not saying these shows were bad, they were cool for their time, but Ninja Turtles started as an indie comic book that was violent, dark, gritty and bloody, and was a parody of comics like these, the original cartoon that everyone loves, was made just to sell the toys, so they needed to make it childish, goofy, hip and full of slang, and tone down the violence, doesn't this sounds like ruining? Also the Transformers cartoon was created to sell the toys, and to this day Transformers is all this, check out the page "To sell toys" in the Transformers Wiki to see how the plot of all Transformers is written to sell as many toys as possible, all of you are overprotecting two long toy commercials.

Now, a counter argument I can agree, is that the main Transformers media became the movies, people know the Transformers more because of the movies than the cartoons, but it's ok, same goes with Marvel and DC superheroes that are more known¬† by movies and shows than with the comics.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment: This movie was very well done for the most part. It filled me with lots of euphoria (not the kind from LSD) and got me really excited. If you are a passionate TMNT fan, this movie should satisfy you. It conjures up that TMNT nostalgia and has plenty of action. Initially, I detested such a movie because "Michael Bay", but this is one of his best movies so far. Some of the things I didn't like include the aesthetics of the turtles; it didn't really bother me but a few improvements would have been better. There is some drama but it is fairly low-key in terms of length. Also, if there was a deeper, more intricate plot, that would have helped a lot. It doesn't entirely follow the backstory of the original TMNT series but it still features some classic elements and killer action! I'm 21 and I thought this movie is very well done. By the way, expect explosions and decent amount of action and some nice humor. Overall, I'd give it 9/10. Better than Age of Extinction for sure and definitely Bay's best movie this year. Hoping for a sequel with a better plot!

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment:
Wow this looks like a pile of crap. No matter how far CGI comes it just ends up looking like a cartoon when it isn't used sparingly, a really expensive cartoon. For those commenters who say it looks realistic, you are probably young. It looks realistic because it's all you know. When I was a very little kid Terminator 2 came out, and we thought the computer animations were so realistic, a few years later Jurassic Park came out, and those Terminator animations suddenly looked so bad and outdated. But Jurrasic Park used them sparingly, and when its sequel came out years later with lots more CGI scenes, those earlier Jurassic Park scenes now looked like crap, but the physical prop dinosaur scenes look better than ever. Same goes for Men in Black. And so on and so on until eventually you can't take rampant CGI seriously.

It just never looks right. No matter how much detail they add, how many different texture effects they use, how cutting edge and expensive they are, I just can't buy it. The lighting never exactly matches with their surroundings, the focus never matches either, and the actors never seem like they're actually talking to anybody.

Yes, these turtles definitely look edgier and slicker, but for a series that was never gritty and dangerous, I'd rather see bad suits than watch the world's most expensive cartoon... (besides ferngully uhh I mean Avatar)

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment:
Apparently a LOT! of people don't know the difference between: a Director and a Producer.¬†
Michal Bay was the Producer of this film! Not the Director! TMNT are my childhood hero's. And I got to say, the film wasn't bad. I went into it with very low expectations. Now, I'm not saying: "its a great film!" But I went in thinking out of 10, it was gonna be about a 2 maybe a 3. But I went out giving it like a 5 or a 6. I like that each of the turtles were distinctly different. Even thought the story line was "meh" it was the personality of all four turtles that kept the film going. And just because Megan Fox is in it, she wasn't the star, the turtles were. And I have to say, the new Shredder armour was terrifying and OP (over powered). But you'd think you need that going against four powerful turtles. (Spoiler), although I wish we kinda saw more of Shredder. There were glimpses of him but nothing really more than him spitting cliche dialogue and actions. It was a great chance for them to build Shredder into something bigger other than throwing him in the story. (Another Spoiler) I kinda wish we saw a traditional or original armour that Shredder used before William F. character decided randomly to "take it to the next level'. I liked his new "transformer armour" (once again, going against four powerful ninja turtles, I'd want that kinda armour too. But overall it wasn't a bad film. Not the best Comic book movie adaptation. But the next TMNT film coming out in 2016 I think they'll do it better.¬†

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment:
Didn't dislike this movie but it was painful to see such a good series get ruined by another sub-par Michael Bay creation. This movie really isn't bad it is just really misguided and its basically whats wrong with everything Michael Bay produces. He does it on purpose, if he actually tried to make a good script and screenplay he could achieve hits that are not only critically acclaimed but visually stunning. Take The Avengers for example.

The Avengers is not only visually stunning and has expensive big budget special effects but it is smartly directed and scripted perfectly along with many other Marvel movies like Guardians of the Galaxy. Michael Bay literally doesn't try at all to develop a good script and instead ruins franchises like Transformers and TMNT by making sappy scatterbrained plots that are so absurd they are painful to watch and he somehow thinks mindless action is going to change the fact that his plotting is agonizingly bad and sinks the entire movie.

If it was up to him he would just make 4 hours of nothing but action but he knows damn well people expect at least some plot so he takes a bunch of bullshit ideas (mostly lame plots like love triangles, teenage issues, and annoying 1 dimensional characters) and blends them in with mindless 4 hour action and that is what he calls a movie and get paid a billion dollars every time he does that. Someone has to protect our beloved franchises from this asshole unless he is willing to change.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment: Some of you forget exactly what a producer is. A producer is someone overseeing a lot of the filmmaking process (and their are many different types of producers who oversee many different parts of filmmaking) because usually some asset of theirs is used in making what is essentially a movie they are paying for one way or another. And what a producer says usually goes since in most cases their own assets are used in the making of a film. So regardless of director, a producer's fingerprint can be all over a film, especially if that producer is also a director. So if it looks Michael Bay...chances are Bay had a hand in how it was written, shot, and/or edited together.

Teenage mutant ninja turtles....lame ass movie.. 1.Why ninjas? In the 90's everyone loved martial arts in movies & tv shows etc, now people listen to music and surf social websites while they shuffle dance. 2. 80-90's surfer boy lingo WTF is up with that? Bottom line for a new teenage mutant ninja turtles version it sucked, it made no sense. For a remake it was horrible.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment:
I got into TMNT back in the 80's when they first came out, and have to say it was a great comic; good story-line, interesting characters, violent, and believe it or not, far from the cheese they have evolved into (maybe a bit corny towards the end, but forgivable)¬†. Truly saddens me what they've become. This movie is going¬†to be "Cock-a-bung-hole, Dude!" ¬†I'd rather be forced to¬†watch¬†a 48hr marathon of¬†Saved by the Bell then suffer through this shameful¬†degradation of a good comic destroyed by the Mindless Hollywood Money-Making Machine.¬†
That said, I have to wonder, why they need to wear masks? Masked or not, they're walking, talking, friggin turtles! Not many of them around. 4 to be exact. It's not like if you saw one unmasked you'd say "Hey, I wonder if he's one of the TMNT?". Right? Someone help me out here, cause I can't recall, did they originally have masks when they first came out, or was that added later?

Comment:
Oh for the love of... SERIOUSLY people! Go educate yourself.

This film isn't directed by Michael Bay. Michael Bay is only a producer. Actually he's not even the only producer. He shares producer credits with 5 other people: Andrew Form, Bradley Fuller, Galen Walker, Scott Mednickm and Ian Bryce. Basically Michael Bay's involvement in this film is exactly 16.6666666667%. The only reason his name is plastered all over this film is because people know who Michael Bay is and what types of films are his. Basically his name is a marketing gimmick.

This is like when people say The Nightmare Before Christmas is a Tim Burton film. Tim only co-produced. TNBC is actually a Henry Selick movie.Ôªø

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment:
Okay, you know what I don't understand about all this?
Fans of the original cartoons: "OMG they look hideous! I HATE this new design." "This is NOTHING like the old design! How creepy!" "They EXPECT us to pay to see THIS? Who would see those ugly monsters?"
Hideous. Creepy. Ugly. Monsters.

ARE YOU EVEN LISTENING TO YOURSELVES?
Since the very beginning, the turtles have established that they are indeed hideous creations to the human race, no matter how cartoony and cute they may have looked in the 80s, 90s, 2003 and 2012 series. To the other cartoon civilians, they were disturbing monsters, and had to hide using their ninja stealth and trenchcoats. Also, wasn't one of their BIGGEST LESSONS that they supposedly taught us as kids was that LOOKS. DO. NOT. MATTER???

I admit that I am fairly new to the franchise, and being a teenage girl I was much more drawn to their cuteness in the 2012 series. But after doing lengthy research on the franchise over the past 3 decades, from the comics up till now, I realized I didn't fall in love with their looks... but as an aspiring animator with a childlike heart, I fell in love with their unique story AND equally unique personalities. Also, they have to make difficult choices and learn lessons ¬†through their adventures that help them grow as characters. I was mixed about it at first, but I might actually have to see this movie, even though I'm very aware it's nothing like the 2012 cartoon I currently adore. It looks much darker and more adult, but you know what? I am an adult and not a pink-and-doll-loving little girl anymore. Therefore, I think I can appreciate a good dark, adult action-comedy, if that what this turns out to be. And from the newer trailers I've seen, the turtles' personalities are VERY lively and true to the consistency of the franchise. True, they're not attractive, but this is 2014 PEOPLE. They can't look like the cuter 80s, 90s, or even 2012 cartoons if they want to get their emotions shown through facial expressions across in a live-action flick. They're not going to use cartoony puppets like the first one, because it's not DIFFERENT. Fresh and new is ESSENTIAL to any good film. The turtles have changed through SO many different interpretations over the years, and that should already be a lesson you've learned if you're over 13. Change happens. Life Happens. SERIOUSLY. I'm not even 20 yet, and I was able to figure that out. So please, people, enough with the butthurt'in and get over it. Nostalgia is a powerful emotion, I know that better than anyone. But it's just that, nostalgia. Time goes on. New memories are created. And with an open mind, you might find that the nostalgia can be found even in something like this.

Judging from this trailer, I honestly do not know what opinion I should have on the movie. No, I don't hate Micheal Bay, I actually like the Transformers movies, but I do dislike how the Turtles look like Knuckles in the new Sonic Boom; completely hopped up on steroids.

I do, however, find it entertaining how they got most personality aspects of the Turtles into this.¬†

I will go out and see this movie with an open mind, unlike most people when they're faced with things that even mention Micheal Bay. I will judge it to see if it can stand up outside of the action scenes, which I know already from the trailer looks cool.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment: I've been a TMNT fan since I was a child. I grew up with the cartoons, comics, games, movies, etc. I've liked just about everything that's ever been TMNT (even a shout out to The Next Mutation, which was kinda dumb). I, personally, think that anyone that's already condemning this should just look at it this way: If the Ninja Turtles were a real thing, would they look like scary badass mutated turtles? Or would they look like silly cartoonish turtles? Exactly. So just ease up on being so negative on how they made them look in this. I think they look freaking bad ass! They look very similar to those ultra realistic drawings I found online before that someone had made to look really creepy authentic. Seriously, give it a shot. Go into it like it's a totally new thing, not like it's an abomination of something from your childhood. If you want to get technical about it, anyone that is on here complaining about this movie ruining your kids' cartoon, isn't really a true TMNT fan, because it's obvious you never read the original comics. Although they do look cartoon-ish there as well, the original comics are far more badass and violent than the cartoons or previous movies have even come close to.I'm stoked for it! Every time I see a new trailer with parts I haven't seen yet, I get even more excited!

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment: Eh, I'm still kind of torn here. I like that this movie actually seems to be ABOUT the Turtles, unlike a good portion of the Transformers films, and I'm not completely turned off by their designs. On the other hand, the Shreddinator seems a bit much. Yes, the Shredder has had robotic armor in past incarnations for one reason or another (Mostly in the 2003 cartoon), but despite that he usually posed a big threat to the Turtles because he was just a REALLY good fighter, without a bunch of tricks and gadgets. Giving him powered armor just makes him seem much less impressive. Like, anyone could be wearing that suit and kick ass, so there's not as much menace about the guy wearing it.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment:
I think there are reboots and there are reboots-for-the-sake-of-reboots. Take for example another reboot: Batman Begins. It really did justice to a reboot because¬†it kept the series fresh with new ideas.

But the reason I stress that it did justice was because the fresh ideas were believable. Everything made sense in BB - the way Wayne got access to his gadgets, the reason why the Bat costume had ears, the reason why his suit had Kevlar, the way Batman has a cowl in the neck of his costume, but does away with it in the sequel, etc.

Over here, this just seems like the blueprint of the Transformers movie had sex with the blueprint of TMNT, and out came a pile of jumbled up trash. This seems like it is trying very hard to be a credible attempt at a reboot.

A real reboot, like Batman Begins, seems effortless.

This seems like they had the mandate to make a reboot first, and then brainstormed how they should reboot it, rather than a TMNT fan having a genuine epiphany of creative genius, and deciding that a reboot was in order.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment: I think this will be a good movie. ¬†I also like the changes Liebesman made for this film. ¬†We live in the 21st century where guns and crime should be portrayed more realistically. ¬†The 90s films were awesome, don't get me wrong and they were funny as ever, but these turtles shouldn't be portrayed like they were in the 90s. ¬†It would be out of picture. ¬†The way they look is a little more scary, but to be honest, I think it was a great decision. ¬†Mainly because they are MUTANT turtles. ¬†And they still look cool! ¬†Honestly though, Mikey is the creepiest looking one, but I like how their looks fit their character, like Don is "nerdy" looking, Ralph looks gruff and tough, and Leo looks like the leader. ¬†Seriously, the turtles look badass, they look like teenage mutant ninja turtles. ¬†Hmmm, i wonder why. ¬†As for Shredder, I think when the guy said, "A robot samurai" he might have made an assumption just because Shredder looks like a robot. ¬†But the other guy said "taking your suit to the next level". ¬†I assume Shredder is still gonna be a human in a high tech suit. ¬†The movie may suck. ¬†The movie may be totally badass. ¬†But Michael Bay is only the PRODUCER, he didn't write the script. ¬†Give it a chance. ¬†The only bad part was casting Megan Fox and not having Casey. ¬†Thumbs up for the trailer, it makes things totally epic. ¬†

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment:
This movie would've been far better with these changes:

1.) Turtles that don't look like trolls
2.) Better visual effects and action sequences.
3.) The Foot Clan actually being Ninja Assassins (although uniting them with ex-military henchmen is not a bad idea)
4.) An Actual Japanese Actor playing Shredder (although I could see Fitchner playing a corporate villain would join forces with Shredder and The Foot along with his (Fitchner) gang of Ex-Special Forces Operatives)
5.) Michael Bay not being involved with the project at all.
6.) A Much better actress to play April 'O' Neil such as Emma Stone, Emma Watson, Jennifer Lawrence or Shailene Woodley.
7.) The mood of the film could've still been family-friendly but also have some Darkness and intensity to it. Something like The Avengers meets Batman Begins type of feel.
8.) A Much better soundtrack. Music that is just as slammin' as Technotronic's music from the original and second Turtle films soundtracks from the 90's. (Spin That Wheel, Awesome, Rocking Over The Beat, Turtle Power, This is How We Do.)

Outside of season one of the original show which still was not nearly as dark as the comic there has not been a version of the turtles close to what I remember reading years ago. So, all of you are going to have to get over it just like I had to get over the terrible writing for the x-men franchise which completely ignored the source material. However the movies were ok. Now that I've go that piece out, from the looks of it the movie doesn't look bad at all¬†and will probably be entertaining.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment:
I think this movie has lots of potential. I also think if everyone stopped complaining that Michael Bay ruined their childhood before the damn movie has even come out, then they would enjoy it more. We don't know what mutated turtles would look like, they could look like the original turtles from the 90's movies or they could look like Bay's concept or even completely different. Any new idea is interesting. Plus we all know what the original story was, a new story is just as interesting because we could get a new twist & we won't be expecting what happens. If they just redid the story of the 90's movie, we would ALL know what happens. I'm happy that the turtles are coming to the big screen again, they were a big part of my childhood & here they are again.¬†
So SCREW all of you, I'm excited to see my 4 fellow green friends kick ass just as they did before.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment:
Well it's better than the last trailer. But I still have mixed feelings about seeing the movie though.
Also I don't agree with everyone saying that this movie ruins the Turtles they grew up with. Because according to Turtles Forever, there are many universes with their own Turtles that have different back stories and looks. So I'm not going to look at this as a retelling of the original story. I'm going to look at this as its own universe with its own turtles. So I don't hate Michael Bay for this.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Official Trailer #2 (2014) - Whoopi Goldberg, Megan Fox Movie HD
Comment:
Well. I have to admit that the turtles are well designed. I don't think they would give them plastic suits like in the old movies :P and they grasp their battle moves from what I see until now. ¬†

My problems:
What I don't like is Megan Fox having another role on a comic book/cartoon franchise. Seriously? Are there any beautiful red hair girls in Hollywood? Only Megan Fox (brunette actually)? And another ''what a nice ass'' joke?
¬†I think producers and fans these days cannot understand that fan service, porn and softporn has specific sites and places :P Marketing shouldn't be all about sex. WE NEED SEX EVERYWHERE.....Not. Especially a Transformers or TMNT movie.¬†

Secondly I don't get the point behind Shredder wearing a hydraulic suit? Wouldn't it be badass to have an actual Asian actor playing Shredder as a powerful martial artist and criminal warlord? This is what Shredder is in the comics and cartoons. The hydraulic armor is just an excuse so that the final battle goes like this:
Shredder kicks everyone's ass until they find a way to deactivate his suit and/or throw him from somewhere or throw something heavy on him :P It is the classic Man vs Machine or Hero vs Stronger Opponent solution in most Hollywood films and it is completely generic that we will see this here too.

Finally I hate dubstep. It is an overestimated and mediocre at best music style. I believe franchises need their own soundtracks orcherstral, epic, rock e.t.c to prevail and be remembered. Dubstep does nothing. Just sells more to young audiences and nothing else, sooo it is another commercial strategy.

We will see. I hope the movie is good overall. ¬†¬†
